column4: There's a problem with sound in Ubuntu 7.10. I hear no sound in any apps. No songs/music/movies anything. When i turn the volume at full and try to hear really hard i hear a slight hiss, I tried plugging my headphones directly into the sound card but still no sound. I have got onboard sound (and nothing fancy) and have never encountered this problem
if all controls look good, try restarting alsa
even did sudo /etc/init.d/alsa-utils restart
still no solution, when alsa is stopped ths slight hiss goes off, again when it starts the hiss is resumed
what does your /var/log/messages say when you start alsa?
Slart: i will have to boot ubuntu for that, could you guys wait a minute and tell me again the commands when i restart?
Slart: ?
what text file did you require?
curious as to the output created in logs from alsa start
i am new, could you tell me the exact name/location of the file you require to see, please?
np, it's /var/log/messages .. just a sec I'm going to play with ways to isolate alsa output

Slart: About the sound proble, when ubuntu loads and the initial bar is 1/4 full the hiss starts and then it remains on forever (when x starts and when i am doing any work) and so no sound is played. Here is that file http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/35236/
Slart: me either... checking...
how long have you been running hiss-free?
ages. like 1.5 years. I ran hiss-free in ubuntu 6.10 and in in 7.04 too. Just last week this hiss started. And simulataneously all sound stopped playing. Well, except the system beep
have you tried reinstalling alsa?
should i? I am sure i didn't mess with it. But how does one do that?
something to the effect of "apt-get --remove alsa; apt-get --install alsa"
i'll have to reboot ubuntu, do that, reboot to window and come in here again. As somehow xchat and gaim can't connect to freenode.net from ubuntu. It says "connection refused"
Slart: agreed
Slart: that would be welcome
